text: is in Kyoto. The bridge connects two sides of the Kamo River in Kyoto Prefecture, Japan. The bridge is part of Sanjō-dōri (三条大通り Third Avenue). ==History== In the Edo period, the Sanjō Ōhashi Bridge Bridge was the end of Tōkaidō road which connected Edo and Kyoto.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Tōkaidō" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 973. The current concrete bridge is made of concrete. It was built in 1950. ==Related pages== * List of the 53 Stations of the Tōkaidō *The Fifty-three Stations of the Tōkaidō ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Bridges in Japan Category:Concrete bridges Category:Buildings and structures in Kyoto Prefecture
title: Sanjō Ōhashi Bridge
